thread.title: Journal launches election manifesto to present business voice to candidates
thread.title_full: Journal launches election manifesto to present business voice to candidates

author: Graeme Whitfield
title: Journal launches election manifesto to present business voice to candidates
text:
Journal launches election manifesto to present business voice to candidates Companies in the North East are being asked to contribute to our election manifesto Share Members of the public vote at a polling station at Broadwood School in Denton Burn. Share Get business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
What are the issues that matter most to the business community in the North East in the run-up to the General Election ? 
The Journal is compiling a business manifesto to put to the candidates in our region to ensure that the voice of business is heard in the election debate. 
The manifesto will be based on a survey of companies which asks them to rank issues affecting businesses in the North East. 
The survey includes issues including devolution, skills, infrastructure, Brexit and the Northern Powerhouse, while people taking part can also add in any issues of their own that the feel are important. To complete the survey please click here 
Over the next few weeks we will compile answers and publish an election manifesto that aims to reflect the views of the local business community. Like us on Facebook
